system.description:
You have delved even deeper into your studies of the nature and theoretical underpinnings of all magic, gaining the following benefits:

  • You may add your scholar levels to your wizard levels to determine the effectiveness of @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-class-features.Item.iqlgotutphoratct]{Arcane Recovery}.  
  • You also learn a number of additional spells from the wizard list equal to your proficiency bonus, adding them to your spellbook, and gain an additional one everytime your proficiency bonus goes up.  These may be of any level for which you have slots, even if your wizard level would not normally be high enough to allow it. Wizard spells gained in other ways, such as on normal level up or by copying from a scroll or spellbook, are limited by your wizard level as normal. If you choose to learn one of these bonus spells normally, either on wizard level up, by copying a scroll or spellbook, or through some other means, you may choose a new bonus spell in its place.
  • You gain one additional Elective Study and Scholarly Discovery of your choice.
